intro: Dianthera distorta, commonly known as the twisted bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. The plant produces small, elongated fruits called capsules, which contain numerous tiny seeds. Dianthera distorta thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its unique floral structure and adaptability to harsh conditions make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
